content:
Henry Constants (at 270°C) and Adsorption Enthalpy of All C<sub>8</sub> Alkylaromatic Components and <italic toggle="yes">n</italic>-Octane<xref rid="tbl1-fn2"></xref> T boil (°C) K′270 (mol/kg/Pa) −ΔH 0 (kJ/mol) ethylbenzene 136 2.5 × 10−4 59.7 ± 0.5 o-xylene 144 2.9 × 10−4 59.6 ± 0.7 m-xylene 139 2.1 × 10−4 59.7 ± 0.7 p-xylene 138 2.2 × 10−4 61.2 ± 0.4 n-octane 126 2.2 × 10−4 65.7 ± 0.6 o-xylene USY 6.0 × 10−5 65.3 ± 3.1 n-octane USY 2.5 × 10−5 56.5 ± 0.5

Data for n-octane and o-xylene on USY zeolite (Si/Al 30) are added as reference.

From: Ph.D. dissertation Joeri Denayer, Vrije Universiteit Brussel, Belgium, Sept 1998, pp. 79.
clean_text: Table 1. Henry Constants (at 270°C) and Adsorption Enthalpy of All C8 Alkylaromatic Components and n-Octane[^b] | | Tboil (°C) | K′270 (mol/kg/Pa) | −ΔH0 (kJ/mol) | |----------------|----------------------|------------------------------|-------------------------| | ethylbenzene | 136 | 2.5 × 10−4 | 59.7 ± 0.5 | | o-xylene | 144 | 2.9 × 10−4 | 59.6 ± 0.7 | | m-xylene | 139 | 2.1 × 10−4 | 59.7 ± 0.7 | | p-xylene | 138 | 2.2 × 10−4 | 61.2 ± 0.4 | | n-octane | 126 | 2.2 × 10−4 | 65.7 ± 0.6 | | o-xylene USY[^a]| | 6.0 × 10−5 | 65.3 ± 3.1 | | n-octane USY[^a]| | 2.5 × 10−5 | 56.5 ± 0.5 | [^a]: Data for n-octane and o-xylene on USY zeolite (Si/Al 30) are added as reference. [^b]: From: Ph.D. dissertation Joeri Denayer, Vrije Universiteit Brussel, Belgium, Sept 1998, pp. 79.

<table-wrap id="tbl2" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>2</label>
<caption>
<title>Average Separation As Calculated from Binary Breakthrough Experiments at a Total Hydrocarbon Pressure of 0.05 to 0.06 Bar (α (breakthrough) and Zero Coverage Separation Factor Obtained by Dividing the Extrapolated Henry Constants (α (Henry Constant)) on MIL-47 at 70 °C</title>
</caption>
<oasis:table>
<oasis:tgroup cols="4">
<oasis:colspec align="left" colname="col1"></oasis:colspec>
<oasis:colspec align="left" colname="col2"></oasis:colspec>
<oasis:colspec align="char" char="." colname="col3"></oasis:colspec>
<oasis:colspec align="char" char="." colname="col4"></oasis:colspec>
<oasis:thead valign="middle">
<oasis:row>
<oasis:entry align="center">mixture</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry align="center">preferred component</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry align="center">α (breakthrough)</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry align="center">α (Henry Constant)</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
</oasis:thead>
<oasis:tbody>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>EB/pX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>pX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.83</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>0.97</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>EB/mX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>mX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.41</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>0.84</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>EB/oX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>oX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.39</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.13</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>mX/pX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>pX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>2.07</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.19</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>oX/mX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>oX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.17</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.35</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
<oasis:row valign="top">
<oasis:entry>oX/pX</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>−</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.01</oasis:entry>
<oasis:entry>1.11</oasis:entry>
</oasis:row>
</oasis:tbody>
</oasis:tgroup>
</oasis:table>
</table-wrap>
clean_text:
Table 2. Average Separation As Calculated from Binary Breakthrough Experiments at a Total Hydrocarbon Pressure of 0.05 to 0.06 Bar (α (breakthrough) and Zero Coverage Separation Factor Obtained by Dividing the Extrapolated Henry Constants (α (Henry Constant)) on MIL-47 at 70 °C

| mixture | preferred component | α (breakthrough) | α (Henry Constant) |
|---------|---------------------|------------------|--------------------|
| EB/pX   | pX                  | 1.83             | 0.97               |
| EB/mX   | mX                  | 1.41             | 0.84               |
| EB/oX   | oX                  | 1.39             | 1.13               |
| mX/pX   | pX                  | 2.07             | 1.19               |
| oX/mX   | oX                  | 1.17             | 1.35               |
| oX/pX   | −                   | 1.01             | 1.11               |
